detaileddescription.para: Use default value defined at upper level
AVPF is disabled
AVPF is enabled
Enum describing RTP AVPF activation modes.
No media encryption is used
Use SRTP media encryption
Use ZRTP media encryption
Use DTLS media encryption
Enum describing type of media encryption types.
Object representing an RTP payload type.
Enum describing RTP AVPF activation modes.
Enum describing type of media encryption types.
Structure describing policy regarding video streams establishments.
Set the name of the mediastreamer2 filter to be used for rendering video. This is for advanced users of the library, mainly to workaround hardware/driver bugs.
Get the name of the mediastreamer2 filter used for rendering video.
Enable adaptive rate control.

Adaptive rate control consists in using RTCP feedback provided information to dynamically control the output bitrate of the audio and video encoders, so that we can adapt to the network conditions and available bandwidth. Control of the audio encoder is done in case of audio-only call, and control of the video encoder is done for audio & video calls. Adaptive rate control feature is enabled by default.
Returns whether adaptive rate control is enabled.
See sephone_core_enable_adaptive_rate_control().
Sets adaptive rate algorithm. It will be used for each new calls starting from now. Calls already started will not be updated.
Returns which adaptive rate algorithm is currently configured for future calls.
See sephone_core_set_adaptive_rate_algorithm().

Sets maximum available download bandwidth This is IP bandwidth, in kbit/s. This information is used signaled to other parties during calls (within SDP messages) so that the remote end can have sufficient knowledge to properly configure its audio & video codec output bitrate to not overflow available bandwidth.

parameterdescription.para: the bandwidth in kbits/s, 0 for infinite

detaileddescription.para: Sets maximum available upload bandwidth This is IP bandwidth, in kbit/s. This information is used by libsephone together with remote side available bandwidth signaled in SDP messages to properly configure audio & video codec's output bitrate.

parameterdescription.para: the bandwidth in kbits/s, 0 for infinite

detaileddescription.para: Retrieve the maximum available download bandwidth. This value was set by sephone_core_set_download_bandwidth().
Retrieve the maximum available upload bandwidth. This value was set by sephone_core_set_upload_bandwidth().
Set audio packetization time sephone expects to receive from peer. A value of zero means that ptime is not specified.
Get audio packetization time sephone expects to receive from peer. A value of zero means that ptime is not specified.
Set audio packetization time sephone will send (in absence of requirement from peer) A value of 0 stands for the current codec default packetization time.
Set audio packetization time sephone will send (in absence of requirement from peer) A value of 0 stands for the current codec default packetization time.

Returns the list of available audio codecs.
lc
The SephoneCore object
A list of PayloadType objects. PayloadType This list is unmodifiable. The ->data field of the MSList points a PayloadType structure holding the codec information. It is possible to make copy of the list with ms_list_copy() in order to modify it (such as the order of codecs).

Returns the list of available video codecs.
lc
The SephoneCore object
A list of PayloadType objects. PayloadType This list is unmodifiable. The ->data field of the MSList points a PayloadType structure holding the codec information. It is possible to make copy of the list with ms_list_copy() in order to modify it (such as the order of codecs).

Sets the list of audio codecs.
lc
The SephoneCore object
codecs
A list of PayloadType objects. PayloadType
0 The list is taken by the SephoneCore thus the application should not free it. This list is made of struct PayloadType describing the codec parameters.

Sets the list of video codecs.
lc
The SephoneCore object
codecs
A list of PayloadType objects. PayloadType
0 The list is taken by the SephoneCore thus the application should not free it. This list is made of struct PayloadType describing the codec parameters.
Returns the nominal audio jitter buffer size in milliseconds.
Returns the nominal video jitter buffer size in milliseconds.
Returns the value in seconds of the no-rtp timeout.

When no RTP or RTCP packets have been received for a while SephoneCore will consider the call is broken (remote end crashed or disconnected from the network), and thus will terminate the call. The no-rtp timeout is the duration above which the call is considered broken.
Sets the nominal audio jitter buffer size in milliseconds. The value takes effect immediately for all running and pending calls, if any. A value of 0 disables the jitter buffer.
Sets the nominal video jitter buffer size in milliseconds. The value takes effect immediately for all running and pending calls, if any. A value of 0 disables the jitter buffer.
Sets the UDP port range from which to randomly select the port used for audio streaming.
Sets the UDP port range from which to randomly select the port used for video streaming.
Sets the no-rtp timeout value in seconds.
See sephone_core_get_nortp_timeout() for details.
Indicates whether SIP INFO is used for sending digits.
Sets whether SIP INFO is to be used for sending digits.
Indicates whether RFC2833 is used for sending digits.
Sets whether RFC2833 is to be used for sending digits.
Get playback sound level in 0-100 scale.
Get ring sound level in 0-100 scale
Get sound capture level in 0-100 scale
Set sound ring level in 0-100 scale
Allow to control microphone level: gain in db
Get microphone gain in db.
Allow to control play level before entering sound card: gain in db
Get playback gain in db before entering sound card.
Set sound playback level in 0-100 scale
Set sound capture level in 0-100 scale
Returns true if the specified sound device can capture sound.

parameterdescription.para: the device name as returned by sephone_core_get_sound_devices()

detaileddescription.para: Returns true if the specified sound device can play sound.

parameterdescription.para: the device name as returned by sephone_core_get_sound_devices()

detaileddescription.para: Sets the sound device used for ringing.

parameterdescription.para: the device name as returned by sephone_core_get_sound_devices()

detaileddescription.para: Sets the sound device used for playback.

parameterdescription.para: the device name as returned by sephone_core_get_sound_devices()

detaileddescription.para: Sets the sound device used for capture.

parameterdescription.para: the device name as returned by sephone_core_get_sound_devices()

detaileddescription.para: Returns the name of the currently assigned sound device for ringing.
Returns the name of the currently assigned sound device for playback.
Returns the name of the currently assigned sound device for capture.
Returns an unmodifiable array of available sound devices.
The array is NULL terminated.
Returns an unmodifiable array of available video capture devices.
The array is NULL terminated.
Sets the path to a wav file used for ringing.

parameterdescription.para: The file must be a wav 16bit linear. Local ring is disabled if null

detaileddescription.para: Returns the path to the wav file used for ringing.
Sets the path to a wav file used for ringing back.
Ringback means the ring that is heard when it's ringing at the remote party. The file must be a wav 16bit linear.
Returns the path to the wav file used for ringing back.

Enables or disable echo cancellation. Value is saved and used for subsequent calls. This actually controls software echo cancellation. If hardware echo cancellation is available, it will be always used and activated for calls, regardless of the value passed to this function. When hardware echo cancellation is available, the software one is of course not activated.
Returns TRUE if echo cancellation is enabled.

Sets the default policy for video. This policy defines whether:
video shall be initiated by default for outgoing calls
video shall be accepter by default for incoming calls
Get the default policy for video. See sephone_core_set_video_policy() for more details.
Controls video preview enablement.
Video preview refers to the action of displaying the local webcam image to the user while not in call.
Returns TRUE if video previewing is enabled.
Enables or disable self view during calls.
Self-view refers to having local webcam image inserted in corner of the video window during calls. This function works at any time, including during calls.
Returns TRUE if self-view is enabled, FALSE otherwise.
Refer to sephone_core_enable_self_view() for details.
Sets the active video device.

parameterdescription.para: the name of the video device as returned by sephone_core_get_video_devices()

detaileddescription.para: Returns the name of the currently active video device.
Returns the native window handle of the video window, casted as an unsigned long.
Set the native video window id where the video is to be displayed. For MacOS, Linux, Windows: if not set or zero the core will create its own window, unless the special id -1 is given.
Returns the native window handle of the video preview window, casted as an unsigned long.

Set the native window id where the preview video (local camera) is to be displayed. This has to be used in conjonction with sephone_core_use_preview_window(). MacOS, Linux, Windows: if not set or zero the core will create its own window, unless the special id -1 is given.
returns current device orientation

Tells the core the device current orientation. This can be used by capture filters on mobile devices to select between portrait/landscape mode and to produce properly oriented images. The exact meaning of the value in rotation if left to each device specific implementations.
lc
object.
rotation
. IOS supported values are 0 for UIInterfaceOrientationPortrait and 270 for UIInterfaceOrientationLandscapeRight.
Returns the zero terminated table of supported video resolutions.
Sets the preferred video size.
This applies only to the stream that is captured and sent to the remote party, since we accept all standard video size on the receive path.

Sets the video size for the captured (preview) video. This method is for advanced usage where a video capture must be set independently of the size of the stream actually sent through the call. This allows for example to have the preview window with HD resolution even if due to bandwidth constraint the sent video size is small. Using this feature increases the CPU consumption, since a rescaling will be done internally.

parameterdescription.para: the video resolution choosed for capuring and previewing. It can be (0,0) to not request any specific preview size and let the core optimize the processing.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns video size for the captured video if it was previously set by sephone_core_set_preview_video_size(), otherwise returns a 0,0 size.
sephone_core_set_preview_video_size()
lc
the core
a MSVideoSize

Returns the effective video size for the captured video as provided by the camera. When preview is disabled or not yet started, this function returns a zeroed video size.
sephone_core_set_preview_video_size()
lc
the core
a MSVideoSize
Sets the preview video size by its name. See sephone_core_set_preview_video_size() for more information about this feature.
Video resolution names are: qcif, svga, cif, vga, 4cif, svga ...
Sets the preferred video size by its name.
This is identical to sephone_core_set_preferred_video_size() except that it takes the name of the video resolution as input. Video resolution names are: qcif, svga, cif, vga, 4cif, svga ...
Returns the current preferred video size for sending.

Set the preferred frame rate for video. Based on the available bandwidth constraints and network conditions, the video encoder remains free to lower the framerate. There is no warranty that the preferred frame rate be the actual framerate. used during a call. Default value is 0, which means "use encoder's default fps value".

parameterdescription.para: the target frame rate in number of frames per seconds.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the preferred video framerate, previously set by sephone_core_set_preferred_framerate().

simplesect.para: frame rate in number of frames per seconds.

detaileddescription.para: Ask the core to stream audio from and to files, instead of using the soundcard.

parameterdescription.para: A boolean value asking to stream audio from and to files or not.

detaileddescription.para: Sets a wav file to be played when putting somebody on hold, or when files are used instead of soundcards (see sephone_core_set_use_files()).
The file must be a 16 bit linear wav file.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file to be played when putting somebody on hold.

detaileddescription.para: Sets a wav file where incoming stream is to be recorded, when files are used instead of soundcards (see sephone_core_set_use_files()).
This feature is different from call recording (sephone_call_params_set_record_file()) The file will be a 16 bit linear wav file.

parameterdescription.para: The path to the file where incoming stream is to be recorded.

detaileddescription.para:
Plays a dtmf sound to the local user.
lc
SephoneCore
dtmf
DTMF to play ['0'..'16'] | '#' | '#'
duration_ms
duration in ms, -1 means play until next further call to sephone_core_stop_dtmf()
Stops playing a dtmf started by sephone_core_play_dtmf().
Sets the maximum transmission unit size in bytes. This information is useful for sending RTP packets. Default value is 1500.

Whenever the libsephone is playing a ring to advertise an incoming call or ringback of an outgoing call, this function stops the ringing. Typical use is to stop ringing when the user requests to ignore the call.

Enable RTCP feedback (also known as RTP/AVPF profile). Setting SephoneAVPFDefault is equivalent to SephoneAVPFDisabled. This setting can be overriden per SephoneProxyConfig with sephone_proxy_config_set_avpf_mode(). The value set here is used for calls placed or received out of any proxy configured, or if the proxy config is configured with SephoneAVPFDefault.
lc
the SephoneCore
mode
the mode.

Return AVPF enablement. See sephone_core_set_avpf_mode() .
lc
the core
the avpf enablement mode.

Return the avpf report interval in seconds.
lc
the SephoneCore
the avpf report interval in seconds.

Set the avpf report interval in seconds. This value can be overriden by the proxy config using sephone_proxy_config_set_avpf_rr_interval().
lc
the core
interval
interval in seconds.

memberdef.argsstring: (SephoneCore *lc, const char *type, int rate, int channels)
memberdef.name: sephone_core_find_payload_type

detaileddescription.para: Get payload type from mime type and clock rate

This function searches in audio and video codecs for the given payload type name and clockrate.
lc
SephoneCore object
type
payload mime type (I.E SPEEX, PCMU, VP8)
rate
can be SEPHONE_FIND_PAYLOAD_IGNORE_RATE
channels
number of channels, can be SEPHONE_FIND_PAYLOAD_IGNORE_CHANNELS
Returns NULL if not found.
Returns the payload type number assigned for this codec.

Force a number for a payload type. The SephoneCore does payload type number assignment automatically. THis function is to be used mainly for tests, in order to override the automatic assignment mechanism.

Enables video globally.

This function does not have any effect during calls. It just indicates SephoneCore to initiate future calls with video or not. The two boolean parameters indicate in which direction video is enabled. Setting both to false disables video entirely.

parameterdescription.para: indicates whether video capture is enabled
indicates whether video display should be shown

detaileddescription.para: Returns TRUE if video is enabled, FALSE otherwise.
Enable or disable video capture.

This function does not have any effect during calls. It just indicates the SephoneCore to initiate future calls with video capture or not.
lc
SephoneCore object.
enable
TRUE to enable video capture, FALSE to disable it.
Enable or disable video display.

This function does not have any effect during calls. It just indicates the SephoneCore to initiate future calls with video display or not.
lc
SephoneCore object.
enable
TRUE to enable video display, FALSE to disable it.
Enable or disable video source reuse when switching from preview to actual video call.

This source reuse is useful when you always display the preview, even before calls are initiated. By keeping the video source for the transition to a real video call, you will smooth out the source close/reopen cycle.

This function does not have any effect durfing calls. It just indicates the SephoneCore to initiate future calls with video source reuse or not. Also, at the end of a video call, the source will be closed whatsoever for now.
lc
SephoneCore object
enable
TRUE to enable video source reuse. FALSE to disable it for subsequent calls.

Tells whether video capture is enabled.
lc
SephoneCore object.
TRUE if video capture is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

Tells whether video display is enabled.
lc
SephoneCore object.
TRUE if video display is enabled, FALSE if disabled.

Use this function when the application is notified of USB plug events, so that list of available hardwares for video capture is updated.

SephoneCore object.

TRUE means the call will fail; FALSE means an INVITE will be resent with encryption disabled.

Use to enable multicast rtp for audio stream.
If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from sephone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into audio cline. In case of outgoing call audio stream is sent to this multicast address. For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.

SephoneCore
yesno
if yes, subsequent calls will propose multicast ip set by sephone_core_set_audio_multicast_addr

Use to enable multicast rtp for video stream. If enabled, outgoing calls put a multicast address from sephone_core_get_video_multicast_addr into video cline. In case of outgoing call video stream is sent to this multicast address. For incoming calls behavior is unchanged.
core
SephoneCore

Wildcard value used by sephone_core_find_payload_type to ignore rate in search algorithm
Wildcard value used by sephone_core_find_payload_type to ignore channel in search algorithm

Multicast Call using rtp multicast addresses are supported for both audio and video with some limitations. Limitations are, no stun, no ice, no encryption. Incoming call with multicast address are automatically accepted. The called party switches in a media receive only mode. Outgoing call willing to send media to a multicast address can activate multicast using linphone_core_enable_video_multicast or linphone_core_enable_audio_multicast . The calling party switches in a media listen send only mode.
